intro: Guajava anthomega, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It has compound leaves that are opposite and can grow up to 12 inches in length. The plant produces small, bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its flowers are inconspicuous, with yellowish petals and numerous stamens. The plant is often used in landscaping but can become invasive in certain environments.
